title: 112_hr6442
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. REPEAL OF THE PROGRAM OF BLOCK GRANTS TO STATES FOR SOCIAL SERVICES." is about the repeal of a program that provides block grants to states for social services. Repeals sections 2001 through 2007 of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to section 404(d) of the Act. The text chunk involves amendments to various sections of the Social Security Act, including striking subparagraphs and redesignating paragraphs. These changes are part of a broader repeal of sections 2001 through 2007 of the Act. Amendments to sections 471, 472, and 473 of the Social Security Act include striking certain paragraphs and redesignating others. These changes are part of a broader repeal of sections 2001 through 2007 of the Act. Amendments to various sections of the Social Security Act involve striking specific sentences and redesignating paragraphs. These changes are part of a larger repeal of sections 2001 through 2007 of the Act. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to eligibility determinations and program titles under title XX. The headings for title XX are also modified to reflect new program focuses. Amendments to various acts, including the Food and Nutrition Act, the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act, the Immigration Reform and Control Act, and the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act, involve striking certain sections and redesignating others. Amendments are made to various acts by striking specific sections and redesignating others, including changes to the Indian Child Welfare Act and Title 31 of the United States Code. Amendments are made to various sections of different acts, including Title 31 of the United States Code and the Public Health Service Act, by striking specific clauses and redesignating others. Amendments are made to different sections of various acts by striking specific clauses and redesignating others. The repeals and amendments made by this section will take effect 60 days after the enactment of the Act.
